title: protoc required by build but not included in Dockerfile
body:
## Bug Report

**What version of Rust are you using?**
<!-- You can run `rustc --version` -->

build in docker

**What operating system and CPU are you using?**
<!-- You can run `cat /proc/cpuinfo` -->

build in docker

**What did you do?**
<!-- If possible, provide a recipe for reproducing the error. A complete runnable program is good. -->

```
cd tikv
docker build -t tikv:v1 .
```
```
   Compiling cop_datatype v0.0.1 (/go/src/github.com/pingcap/tikv/components/cop_datatype)
error: failed to run custom build command for `kvproto v0.0.1 (https://github.com/pingcap/kvproto.git#84f2c621)`
process didn't exit successfully: `/go/src/github.com/pingcap/tikv/target/release/build/kvproto-20e0446f3572c4d0/build-script-build` (exit code: 101)
--- stderr
thread 'main' panicked at 'Invalid version of protoc (required 3.1.x), or protoc not installed

stdout:

', /root/.cargo/git/checkouts/kvproto-e694950bee90bc86/84f2c62/build.rs:65:9
note: Run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace.

warning: build failed, waiting for other jobs to finish...
error: build failed
make: *** [release] Error 101
```

**What did you expect to see?**

All required tools are included in Dockerfile, so it builds without any dependency from host.

**What did you see instead?**

protoc missed resulted in build failure
